title: Development and Application of a Collaborative Inquiry Learning Model: Elementary Social Studies Curriculum

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary social concepts understanding and simple problem-solving experience
context.additional_context: Social studies curriculum integration for grades 4–6, supporting collaborative activities with digital devices (tablets/PCs); mandatory small-group (4–6 students) formation in classrooms

learning_goals: Learners can explain the inquiry-based collaboration stages (question formulation, hypothesis development, data collection, analysis, conclusion, reflection) with over 80% accuracy.

Learners can apply metacognitive strategies (self-questioning, monitoring, adjusting) at least three times during small-group problem-solving for social issues, enhancing their problem-solving skills.
Learners can submit collaborative inquiry results in visual/ report formats through project-based assessment and achieve a score of 3 or higher (out of 5) on the rubric.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
